author: @httweets
title: Painting roofs white helps lower city heat, studies say - Hindustan Times
text: Painting roofs white helps lower city heat, studies say Painting roofs white helps lower city heat, studies say White or reflective paint is more effective at cooling cities than covering roofs in solar panels or greenery, scientists say, and could offer some relief on extremely hot summer days. Two separate studies looked at the effect of 'cool roofing' and found using white or reflective coatings could reduce outdoor city temperatures by up to 2 degrees Celsius. Scientists at University College London used a model of Greater London to test various cooling methods against its hottest days of 2018, when the city endured a record-breaking summer. The results, published on Thursday in the journal Geophysical Research Letters, found that if adopted widely, cool roofs could reduce the surrounding temperature between 1.2C to 2C. Other approaches, like planting vegetation at street level or installing solar panels, provided a much smaller cooling effect at about 0.3C on average across London, the study found. Covering roofs in greenery had a "negligible" impact on temperatures, it found, though could offer other benefits like better water draining and habitats for wildlife. "We comprehensively tested multiple methods that cities like London could use to adapt to and mitigate warming temperatures, and found that cool roofs were the best way to keep temperatures down during extremely hot summer days," said the study's lead author, Oscar Brousse from UCL. "Other methods had various important side benefits, but none were able to reduce outdoor urban heat to nearly the same level." Scientists also found that air conditioning, which transfers heat from inside buildings to the outside, could warm the environment by as much as 1C in dense central London. "By reflecting rather than absorbing heat, cool roofs have the dual benefit of not only cooling the outside urban environment but the inside of buildings as well," the report said. A separate study published in March looked at real-world results from painting not just roofs, but also roads and outside walls white in an industrial district of Singapore. Researchers demonstrated that overall temperatures were reduced up to 2C in the afternoon, helping pedestrians feel 1.5C cooler in tropical climes. Lighter surfaces reflect heat rather than absorbing it, an effect known as albedo. Surfaces with high albedo include snow and ice, or light-coloured urban materials. By contrast, asphalt has low albedo, absorbing more energy and therefore heat, as do oceans and forests. Roofing made of white plastic materials have been found in other studies to reflect 80 percent of sunlight that reaches it. Among other locations, cool roofing has already been rolled out in Greece, which is vulnerable to scorching summer highs, and parts of India where heatwaves can be extreme. Some experiments painting roads and footpaths white have proven less popular, with some complaints about glare and dirty surfaces in cities that tested this approach in the United States and France. Cities are 'heat islands' that experience higher temperatures than their surroundings, with energy from the sun absorbed in buildings and roads. As the world's population continues to migrate to cities, and heatwaves become longer and stronger because of climate change, finding ways to adapt will become a priority for urban planners. White roofing was "a minimally intrusive solution for urban cooling that has an immediate effect compared to other options" that require more intervention, said E V S Kiran Kumar Donthu, the lead author of the Singapore study. dep/np/db This article was generated from an automated news agency feed without modifications to text. author: Sourav Rudra
title: A Problem in the Linux Kernel Yet Again: This Time, It's Bcachefs!
text: 2024's been an interesting year for the Linux kernel, more so in the final months when we saw the expulsion of Russian maintainers over compliance requirements, and then a subsequent move by Russia to build its own Linux community . Linux kernel development is no stranger to a few controversies here and there, but geopolitics affecting their work was a surprise indeed. Unfortunately, something else has happened now that involves Bcachefs , the copy-on-write (COW) filesystem for Linux that focuses on reliability and being a robust alternative to ZFS and Btrfs. What's Going On With Bcachefs? Kent Overstreet, the creator of Bcachefs, has put out a blog detailing how the future of Bcachefs in the Linux kernel looks uncertain, as Linus Torvalds has rejected a pull from him for the upcoming Linux 6.13, citing ‚Äúan open issue with the CoC board‚Äù. If you didn't know, the Linux kernel CoC committee (mentioned as ‚Äúboard‚Äù above) is tasked with enforcing the Code of Conduct (CoC) that applies to the project, both in project spaces and in the public. The latter is applicable when an individual is publicly representing the project or the community as a whole, including on social media or online/offline events. The consensus is that a recent offensive reply (back in September) by Kent to Linux memory management (MM) developer, Michal Hocko is behind the suspension. As you can see below, Kent was not happy with how Michal was handling things related to PF_MEMALLOC_NORECLAIM. In subsequent replies, Kent was asked by Shuah Khan of the Linux kernel CoC committee to not use such language, and to adhere to the Code of Conduct. To that, Kent responded that he had worked this out .) with Michal privately, with the CoC committee receiving the copies of the interactions. However, Shuah didn't let it go ), asserting that he had to apologize. Consequently, there has been plenty of discussion over this, with Kent refusing to apologize publicly. What Happens Now? All of this seems to have been taken up a notch by the formalized CoC enforcement policy that was published on November 14, 2024. It expands on what kind of actions might be taken in cases of unacceptable behavior. There are provisions on it that can be used against offenders. With a public apology by the offender being the first one. If an offender doesn't do that, then a ban from participating in kernel development, either for a short period or a full kernel development cycle, could be handed out. In such a case, the offender may be required to publicly apologize to get back in, but that is not a mandatory requirement. The CoC committee has the final say in that. Kent's blog appeared a few days after the publishing of the policy, so it looks like this is likely to be a drawn-out dispute. In the blog, he goes on to share that his reply was not meant to be malicious or personal, and things like this happen when developers get into technical arguments. As for the CoC's handling of the situation (via Shuah), many Linux kernel maintainers, including Kent, are unhappy with how heavy-handed the interactions have been, with CoC enforcement also being brought into question. If you are interested in reading the ongoing conversation surrounding this, then you can go through the original thread that is at the core of it all. In the end, some questions remain: What will happen to the Bcachefs implementation in the mainline Linux kernel? Will it stay or go away? Is this a temporary suspension for Kent Overstreet, or a more permanent one? For answers to all that, we have to wait and see what happens. üí¨ Tell me what you think of this situation in the comments below! Suggested Read üìñ Here's why you should opt for It's FOSS Plus Membership - Even the biggest players in the Linux world don't care about desktop Linux users. We do. - We don't put content behind paywall. Your support keeps it open for everyone. Think of it like 'pay it forward'. - Don't like ads? With the Plus membership, you get an ad-free reading experience. - When millions of AI-generated content is being published daily, you read and learn from real human Linux users. - It costs just $2 a month, less than the cost of your favorite burger.

author: La r√©daction avec AFP
title: R√©chauffement climatique. 2024 ann√©e la plus chaude, +1,5¬∞C sur deux ans... Comment le sait-on ?
text:
R√©chauffement climatique 2024 ann√©e la plus chaude, +1,5¬∞C sur deux ans... Comment le sait-on ?
L'observatoire europ√©en Copernicus a annonc√© ce vendredi que les deux derni√®res ann√©es ont d√©pass√© en moyenne la limite de 1,5¬∞C de r√©chauffement fix√©e par l'accord de Paris, et que 2024 a bel et bien √©t√© l'ann√©e la plus chaude jamais enregistr√©e depuis le d√©but des statistiques. Mais comment parvient-on √† l'estimer ?
C'est officiel. Les deux derni√®res ann√©es, soit 2023 et 2024, ont d√©pass√© en moyenne la limite de 1,5¬∞C de r√©chauffement fix√©e par l'accord de Paris, signe d'une hausse des temp√©ratures continue et in√©dite dans l'histoire moderne, a annonc√© ce vendredi l'observatoire europ√©en Copernicus.
Comme pressenti depuis des mois, et d√©sormais confirm√© par l'ensemble des temp√©ratures jusqu'au 31 d√©cembre, 2024 a bel et bien √©t√© l'ann√©e la plus chaude jamais enregistr√©e depuis le d√©but des statistiques en 1850, a confirm√© le Service changement climatique (C3S) de Copernicus.
Ce constat ¬´ devrait tous nous alarmer ¬ª a d√©clar√© sur X ce vendredi le ministre britannique charg√© de la neutralit√© carbone, Ed Miliband. ¬´ Nous cacher la t√™te dans le sable serait une trahison pour les g√©n√©rations futures ¬ª. Mais ¬´ nous avons les r√©ponses pour affronter cette menace existentielle ¬ª, a-t-il ajout√©, estimant que ¬´ le d√©sespoir n'est pas une option ¬ª.
Comment le sait-on ?
Mais comment peut-on savoir que l'ann√©e 2024 est la plus chaude jamais mesur√©e sur Terre depuis 1850 ?
¬´ Quand on veut conna√Ætre les climats du pass√©, on cherche une archive qui a enregistr√© les variations de temp√©rature ¬ª, explique le pal√©oclimatologue Etienne Legrain, joint pendant sa mission de recherche dans l'Antarctique. Par exemple, les ¬´ carottes s√©dimentaires marines, compos√©es des s√©diments qui tombent au fond des oc√©ans ¬ª: ceux-ci ¬´ sont remplis de bestioles -les foraminif√®res- qui enregistrent dans leur coquille les temp√©ratures du moment o√π elles vivaient ¬ª, raconte-t-il.
¬´ Il y a aussi les carottes de glace, avec plusieurs m√©thodes: une tr√®s simple consiste √† mettre un thermom√®tre dans un trou qu'on va forer sur 3 km et plus on descend profond, plus on remonte dans le temps pour lire la temp√©rature de la glace, qui reste toujours la m√™me qu'√† l'√©poque de sa formation ¬ª, d√©crit ce scientifique de l'Universit√© libre de Bruxelles, tout juste rentr√© d'une exp√©dition sur les glaciers du p√¥le sud.
Des archives dans la glace
¬´ Une autre consiste √† peser le poids d'une mol√©cule de glace, ce qui donne la temp√©rature au moment o√π la glace s'est d√©pos√©e ¬ª. Les carottes de glace permettent de remonter √† plus d'un million d'ann√©es dans le temps.
¬´ Quand on analyse toutes ces archives tr√®s diff√©rentes ¬ª, les communaut√©s de chercheurs distinctes ¬´ tombent sur les m√™mes courbes de temp√©ratures, c'est pour √ßa qu'on a une certitude assez forte ¬ª, r√©sume-t-il, m√™me s'ils ne parviennent pas √† une pr√©cision au dixi√®me de degr√©.
Conclusion, selon le Giec : les temp√©ratures mondiales de la derni√®re d√©cennie (2011-2020), environ 1,1¬∞C plus chaudes que la p√©riode 1850-1900, ¬´ ont d√©pass√© celles de la plus r√©cente p√©riode chaude multi-s√©culaire ¬ª d'il y a environ 6 500 ans, qui √©tait seulement 0,2 √† 1¬∞C plus chaude que l'√©poque pr√©-industrielle.
¬´ Avant cela, la plus r√©cente p√©riode chaude remonte √† environ 125 000 ans, lorsque la temp√©rature pluris√©culaire (0,5¬∞C √† 1,5¬∞C par rapport √† 1850-1900) chevauche les observations de la d√©cennie ¬ª √©coul√©e, √©crivent les climatologues mandat√©s par l'ONU.
¬´ On a un pris presque un degr√© en 50 ans ! ¬ª
¬´ Les marges d'erreur ne nous permettent pas de dire que le climat actuel est plus chaud que l'E√©mien ¬ª, le nom de cette p√©riode de quelques milliers d'ann√©es de r√©chauffement, juste avant la derni√®re √®re glaciaire, explique Etienne Legrain.
¬´ Mais ce qui est certain, si l'on reste sur les trajectoires d'√©missions de gaz a effet de serre actuelles, c'est que le climat attendu √† la fin du si√®cle sera le plus chaud depuis au moins 800 000 ans ¬ª, avertit le chercheur, puisque, selon l'Onu, l'humanit√© met la plan√®te sur la voie d'un r√©chauffement de pr√®s de 3¬∞C par rapport au 19e si√®cle. ¬´ L'E√©mien correspond √† une augmentation de 5-7¬∞C de temp√©rature moyenne sur 10 000 ans, soit environ +1¬∞C tous les 2 000 ans. Nous, on a un pris presque un degr√© en 50 ans ! ¬ª, souligne Etienne Legrain. Le r√©chauffement tr√®s lent et graduel de l'√©poque pass√©e avait, jadis, permis aux √™tres vivants de s'adapter.

author: Vitoria Lopes Gomez
title: ‚ÄúSolo inteligente‚Äù pode resolver escassez de √°gua na planta√ß√£o; veja como
text: A √°gua √© parte essencial do processo de [planta√ß√£o](https://olhardigital.com.br/tag/plantacao/), mas a escassez do recurso natural em alguns locais pode inibir a [agricultura](https://olhardigital.com.br/tag/agricultura/) e ter consequ√™ncias na seguran√ßa alimentar da popula√ß√£o. Pesquisadores da Universidade do [Texas](https://olhardigital.com.br/tag/texas/) em Austin (EUA) desenvolveram um ‚Äúsolo inteligente‚Äù que [aumentar√° a capacidade das planta√ß√µes](https://olhardigital.com.br/2024/07/12/pro/como-robos-estao-revolucionando-agricultura-brasileira/) usando muito menos √°gua. O trabalho se baseia em hidrogel capaz de aumentar a produ√ß√£o em mais de 130%. Solo inteligente permite plantar mais com menos √°gua O solo inteligente desenvolvido pelos pesquisadores americanos pode mudar como uma planta√ß√£o utiliza √°gua. Segundo o [New Atlas](https://newatlas.com/science/smart-soil-hydrogel-bigger-crops-less-water/), ele mant√©m as plantas hidratadas e com libera√ß√£o controlada de nutrientes ‚Äì sem contar o aumento na produ√ß√£o. Para aumentar a efici√™ncia da planta√ß√£o, o novo [estudo](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/full/10.1021/acsmaterialslett.4c01120) adicionou hidrogel especialmente formulado ao solo. Ele funciona absorvendo vapor de √°gua do ar durante a noite e o liberando de volta para as ra√≠zes das plantas durante o dia. Um toque de cloreto de c√°lcio na composi√ß√£o do hidrogel permite libera√ß√£o mais lenta dos nutrientes. Leia mais: [Como escolher o tamanho do Galaxy Ring da Samsung](https://olhardigital.com.br/2024/07/17/dicas-e-tutoriais/como-escolher-o-tamanho-do-galaxy-ring-da-samsung/) [O que √© mesh shader e como funciona a ferramenta](https://olhardigital.com.br/2023/11/09/tira-duvidas/o-que-e-mesh-shader-e-como-funciona-a-ferramenta/) [Brita que captura CO‚ÇÇ aumenta rendimento das colheitas em at√© 16%](https://olhardigital.com.br/2024/04/04/ciencia-e-espaco/brita-que-captura-co%e2%82%82-aumenta-rendimento-das-colheitas-em-ate-16/) Solo foi testado e aumentou efici√™ncia da planta√ß√£o - A inven√ß√£o foi testada em laborat√≥rio, com plantas cultivadas em dez gramas de solo; - Em algumas das amostras, o solo continha 0,1 grama de hidrogel; - A planta√ß√£o foi observada durante ciclo de dia e noite, com 12 horas de escurid√£o a 25 ¬∞C e 60% a 90% de umidade relativa, seguido por 12 horas de luz solar simulada a 35 ¬∞C e 30% de umidade; - As plantas no solo inteligente (com hidrogel) tiveram aumento de 138% no comprimento do caule em rela√ß√£o √†s que foram plantadas em solo comum; - As plantas no solo inteligente tamb√©m precisaram de 40% menos √°gua para chegar nesse resultado. Solo inteligente pode ajudar a combater escassez na planta√ß√£o De acordo com Guihua Yu, autor correspondente do estudo, o solo inteligente pode ajudar a combater a escassez de √°gua para melhorar a efici√™ncia da planta√ß√£o. A escassez global de √°gua, juntamente com uma popula√ß√£o crescente, tem impacto imediato na seguran√ßa alimentar. Esta nova classe de hidrog√©is oferece solu√ß√£o promissora para atender √†s necessidades urgentes de escassez de √°gua e absor√ß√£o eficiente de nutrientes na agricultura sustent√°vel moderna.Guihua Yu, autor correspondente do projeto, em entrevista ao New Atlas Pr√≥ximos estudos da equipe v√£o analisar o resultado usando outros tipos de experimentos, al√©m da observa√ß√£o a longo prazo.

author: VNExplorer
title: ‚ÄúThis Has Been Going On And On‚Äù: CNN Cuts Away From Donald Trump Press Conference As Former President Makes Marathon Opening Statement
text: Donald Trump speaks to reporters at his Bedminster golf club. Photo by Adam Gray/Getty Images Donald Trump opened his latest press conference by delivering an opening statement that went on ‚Ä¶ and on. After 30 minutes, CNN cut away. CNN‚Äôs Wolf Blitzer told viewers, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre continuing to monitor the former president of the United States. He‚Äôs still with his so called opening statement that‚Äôs been going on well more than a half an hour, close to 40 minutes already‚Ä¶This has been going on and on.‚Äù In his remarks, Trump, reading from written remarks, laid the blame for inflation on his rival Kamala Harris, while accusing her of pursuing ‚Äúcommunist‚Äù policies. But he also attacked Harris on the border, crime and other issues, and even predicted that her election would lead to a 1929-style stock market crash. On Fox News, which stayed with the remarks, the ticker showed the market getting a big boost during the day, with the Dow rising more than 500 points. Related Stories News Joe Biden Meets With Martin Sheen In Brief White House &#039;West Wing&#039; Moment News Kamala Harris Campaign Says It Agreed To A Second Debate With Donald Trump, Rejects More Than One VP Faceoff MSNBC bypassed the remarks altogether. The networks faced some criticism last week for carrying Trump‚Äôs press conference in Palm Beach, allowing him to advance falsehoods without a real-time fact check. As it typically does, CNN went to a fact check with Daniel Dale, who said that many of Trump‚Äôs claims have been ‚Äúdebunked before.‚Äù He focused on two: One that California allows people to rob stores as long as the thieves take under $950, and the other that mortgage rates are at 10%, when the standard 30-year fixed is at 6.9%. CNN did return to the press conference once Trump started taking questions ‚Äî after about 50 minutes. Subscribe to Deadline Get our Breaking News Alerts and Keep your inbox happy. Sign Up

author: iheart.com
title: Sail Away with Jamie Roberts and 98.3TRY | 98.3 WTRY
text:
Book your Cruise with AAA Northway and Sail with Jaime Roberts and 98-3 TRY on an exciting 9 Night Listener Cruise to Bermuda and the Eastern Caribbean ‚Äì aboard Royal Caribbean‚Äôs Liberty of the Seas¬Æ!
Join Jaime Roberts on an unforgettable journey for nine nights of non-stop excitement with some spectacular destinations along the way including ‚Äì Bermuda, San Maarten, San Juan and Labadee! Sail roundtrip from Cape Liberty, New Jersey ‚Äì Departing May 29, 2025 ‚Äì for 9 Nights.
On the ship, there‚Äôs three pools, a water park ‚Äì featuring exhilarating slides like Tidal Wave, and the very exciting Flow-Rider Surfing Simulator!
Indulge yourself‚Äîenjoy many fantastic dining experiences included at a wide variety of eateries. Add in fun like endless entertainment options! From captivating theater shows and live music to even movie screenings. Imagine yourselves savoring the new culinary delights at Sabor and Giovanni's Table and then, unwinding at one of the ship's many bars and lounges.
With panoramic ocean view staterooms and vibrant onboard activities, your Royal Caribbean cruise to Bermuda and the Eastern Caribbean, promises many unforgettable memories. So, join Jaime as she sets sail!
Discover the excitement awaiting you aboard our next amazing WTRY cruise!
Where are we going? Bermuda, discover a history-filled paradise full of pink sand beaches!
Your journey begins with an enchanting visit to Bermuda , where vibrant history and stunning landscapes await. Explore the historic Royal Navy Dockyard, relax on pink sand beaches and snorkel in crystal-clear waters filled with colorful marine life. Whether you're wandering the charming streets of Hamilton or discovering the wonders of Crystal Caves, Bermuda offers an idyllic blend of adventure and relaxation.
Experience the cosmopolitan charm of Philipsburg in St. Maarten!
Next, experience the cosmopolitan charm of Philipsburg in St. Maarten, where Dutch and French influences create a unique cultural tapestry. Stroll along the picturesque Great Bay Beach, shop at duty-free boutiques on Front Street, or savor delectable Caribbean cuisine at waterfront restaurants. Dive into water sports like snorkeling on crystal-clear waters. With its stunning beaches, lively evenings, and welcoming atmosphere, Philipsburg is a captivating destination that promises unforgettable memories.
Discover the vibrant culture and rich history of San Juan, Puerto Rico!
Wander through the colorful streets of Old San Juan , where cobblestone pathways lead to iconic landmarks like El Morro and San Cristobal forts. Immerse yourself in the lively local cuisine, music, and art, or relax on stunning beaches such as Condado and Isla Verde. Discover the city's rich cultural heritage in its colonial architecture, lively cafes, and quaint plazas‚Äîwhile exploring museums and unique shops scattered throughout the old city. Hunt for artisan products and one-of-a-kind souvenirs that reflect the vibrant spirit of Puerto Rico. Whether you're exploring historical sites, or indulging in modern amenities, San Juan is sure to captivate!
And‚Ä¶ Yes! Your Own Private Paradise in Labadee, Haiti!
Nestled along the northern coast, Royal Caribbean's exclusive private paradise is a stunning destination, framed by pristine beaches, lush tropical landscapes and the sparkling Caribbean Sea.
Adventure seekers can soar high above the water on the Dragon‚Äôs Breath Flight Line , the world's longest over-water zipline, or kayak along the coastline to discover hidden coves and secluded spots! For those looking to relax, lounge on the soft sands of Adrenaline Beach, where you can sip on a refreshing drink while soaking in the sun.
Labadee also offers a vibrant local culture, with opportunities to shop for handcrafted artisan goods, sample delicious local flavors, or even enjoy a traditional Haitian dance performance! Whether you're snorkeling in crystal-clear waters, exploring the tropical terrain on a nature trail, or unwinding in a private cabana, Labadee provides the perfect blend of excitement and relaxation‚Äîa memorable finale to an unforgettable journey!
Cruise Details:

author: Sky Sport
title: Roma, infortunio per Smalling: difesa in emergenza contro il Napoli
text: Roma, infortunio per Smalling: difesa in emergenza contro il Napoliroma Nota stonata per la Roma nella vittoria del recupero contro l'Udinese: Smalling ha abbandonato il campo per un infortunio all'inguine che sar√† valutato venerd√¨ 26 aprile, rischia di saltare la prossima partita contro il Napoli. Con Llorente squalificato e Ndicka ancora out, allo stadio "Maradona" gli unici centrali a disposizione di De Rossi saranno Mancini e Huijsen De Rossi festeggia un'altra vittoria, ma la sua Roma perde un pezzo importante in vista della partita contro il Napoli, in programma al Maradona domenica 28 aprile alle ore 18. All'88' Smalling ha abbandonato il campo per infortunio, sostituito da Llorente. Il difensore inglese ha lamentato un problema all'inguine. Domani, venerd√¨ 26 aprile, verr√† valutato con esami approfonditi, ma sembrerebbe a forte rischio per il match contro il Napoli. Considerando la squalifica di Llorente e l'indisponibilit√† di Ndicka, ancora out dopo lo pneumotorace subito nella prima parte della sfida all'Udinese, De Rossi con gli azzurri avr√† solo Mancini e Huijsen a disposizione come centrali difensivi. Una coppia obbligata, che dovr√† essere preservata in questi giorni, a meno che l'allenatore giallorosso non decida di pensare a qualcosa di diverso.

author: manzitor
title: #26 S√°nchez celebra la salida de Vox de gobiernos auton√≥micos: "Es un gran d√≠a para Espa√±a"
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
Al final el gobierno frankenstein, el que iba a reventar por un lado u otro, ah√≠ sigue. Y mientras el PP teniendo que lidiar con una panda de paletos vociferantes como aliados, y ahora adem√°s con una escisi√≥n a√∫n m√°s paleta y a√∫n m√°s vociferante.
Pues voy a hacer de abogado del diablo. Lo primero de todo es que avisaron de salirse de los gobiernos si se cumpl√≠a lo del reparto de menores...y han cumplido. Seguramente si hubieran reculado ya estar√≠amos con el mantra de los sillones y las poltronas.
Se est√° celebrando el reparto, cuando seguimos sin atajar el problema. Muchos de ellos no son menores, no tenemos informaci√≥n alguna suya previa y por mucho que digamos donde deber√≠an estar es con sus familias.
Supongo que desde la perspectiva de la "izquierda" esto es una fiesta. Pero no todo el mundo piensa igual y esto es un problema que ni los pol√≠ticos de izquierda o derecha se van a comer en sus barrios y casas.
Luego vendr√°n los sesudos an√°lisis del auge de la ultra derecha.
Y bueno, ahora ya pod√©is tildarme de fascista o lo que os salga de las pelotas por no seguir el ideario est√°ndar de la izquierda.
[#8](c8#c-8) Es el asunto del tonto, el dedo y la luna. Pero ya sabemos que eso en la izquierda no ocurre. Somos moralmente superiores.
[#6](c6#c-6) los menores (y mayores) van a seguir viniendo a Espa√±a le guste a quien le guste. Salvo que pongas a la armada a disparar a los cayucos como proponen estos neandertales.
Puedes hacer dos cosas:
1) ayudar a √Åfrica para que no vengan
2) aprovechar que vienen y darles una educaci√≥n y una salida laboral
A m√≠ me vale cualquiera de las dos. Lo que me parece inaceptable y est√∫pido es usar la inmigraci√≥n como un arma electoral.
[#6](c6#c-6) El problema es el mismo de siempre. Si omites las guerras que provocamos, la inmigraci√≥n estar√≠a en mismas cifras que en 2018.
El problema, de ser ese y no la natalidad, pero no voy a entrar en eso. Ese supuesto problema no se ataja con antorchas en casas de acogida de ni√±os, ni despotricando, ni siquiera ahogando los con balas de goma cuando cruzan la frontera nadando.
Se arregla con pol√≠tica, relaciones con marruecos y negociaci√≥n. Es la √∫nica forma. No con pirados con antorchas.
Una vez se cruza la frontera, si no sabes a donde deportarlos, debes cumplir con los derechos humanos y respetar la dignidad de las personas.
Pq no te olvides que aunque musulmanes y negros, son seres humanos cuyo delito principal es querer buscarse la vida.
[#6](c6#c-6) Un poco historia te har√° m√°s ilustrado. Las migraciones son milenarias, y lo seguir√°n siendo y eso no lo va a parar ning√∫n gobierno te guste o no, porque qui√©n no tiene nada, le da igual perder lo poco que tiene. Y otra cosa. Europa necesita 50 mill. de migrantes si quiere seguir siendo algo en el mundo,y √Åfrica tiene casi la mitad de su poblaci√≥n con menos de 40 a√±os. Les necesitamos nos guste o no.
[#1](c1#c-1) son unos sinverg√ºenzas. Ellos y los que los apoyan. Mucho marketing, pero ah√≠ seguimos apoyando el belicismo OTAN.
Ni las auton√≥micas ni las europeas contaron con mi voto.
Si se piensan que se van a mantener con el "que vienen los fachas" y seguir apoyando los genocidios de ucrania y palestina van de puto culo.
Teniendo en cuenta el contexto, que vox es un partido de gente que ha demostrado tener poca capacidad de gestionar, que es un partido para hacer ruido en la oposici√≥n m√°s que para gobernar (igual que podemos en este punto), y que esta crisis de los menores no es ni de lejos representativo del problema inmigratorio.
Pero hay que reconocer que esto es un gesto de honestidad que no recordamos en la pol√≠tica espa√±ola. Renunciar a poltronas porque se han incumplido puntos que eran importantes para ellos desde el punto de vista de programa. Sobre cualquier otro partido (desde el PP a indepes o el psoe) hay cientos de ejemplos de lo contrario, de aferrarse al sill√≥n y capear las preguntas con una desverg√ºenza acojonante.
[#10](c10#c-10)
La intolerancia no es algo positivo.
Cuando tu negocias un gobierno y m√°s si eres una minor√≠a est√°s obligado a aceptar cosas que no vienen en tu programa. Se llama negociar.
Todo por repartirse 300-400 ni√±os entre 44 millones de espa√±oles, ni√±os que ya est√°n en Espa√±a (s√≠, Canarias, se√±or Abascal, es Espa√±a y hay que ser solidaria con ella, que tambi√©n hay espa√±oles all√≠) y cosa que lleva haci√©ndose cada a√±o. Ultra"cat√≥licos" negando el auxilio a ni√±os. VAYA VAYA.
Es que no dan para m√°s. Ni honor ni pollas, es que son tontos. El "honor" es para las batallas, no para la pol√≠tica.
Me arremango el faj√≠n y apurandome el Cinzano promulgo:
-Hay un movimiento divertido en la derecha, al crecer Vox, el PP se vio obligado a endurecer sus posturas mas escoradas para intentar recuperar los votos del ala mas reaccionaria que se iban desangrando pa Vox, eso es lo que vimos estos a√±os, un "a ver quien dice la idiotez mas gorda". Esta semana asistimos a una nueva din√°mica encabezada por el follaardillas, Vox ha visto como le crece un enano por la derecha, no puede permitirlo, o sea q se enfurru√±an y se cierran en banda haciendo bandera de... pos algo tan propagandistico y de impacto entre el electorado mas ultra como los MENAS... (Aunque sea algo tan anecd√≥tico como 21 personas, muchos ni√±os, pa acoger en una comunidad como Castilla.... q lo pones en perspectiva y dices q cojones 21 personas no tienes donde meterlas en la espa√±a vacia???? Esto no es "problema" esto es publicidad pa sus cafeteros) Con lo que puede ojo puede, que el PP vuelva a intentar pegar un giro hacia el centro (con el debilitamiento del ala dura del partido, Ayuso juapa, te miro a ti q ultimamente estas muy callada) y dejar que Vox y Alvise se maten a garrotazos a ver quien es mas y muy Ejpa√±√≥
Golpe en la barra erupto, ni√±o ponte una tapita aqui anda, que hay que darle culto al cuerpo
las que m√°s te afectan.
Entre muchas otras, presupuestos y reforma laboral a pesar de los sobornos a sallas y adanero y el golpe de estado del por entonces TC pepesuno.
Para no aprobar leyes... Recuerdas cu√°nto estuvo Rajoy sin presupuestos? Gracias a eso el hundimiento de Espa√±a se relajo esos √∫ltimos a√±os de gobierno de la trotona, que no pudo robar todo lo que quiso como hab√≠a hecho con la sareb.
Era para
#_13 que tiene estrabismo intelectual y los dos ojos le miran para el mismo lado.

author: Stephanie Martin
title: Gifts of the Holy Spirit: Help Young People Explore & Use Their Gifts
text:
By studying the gifts of the Holy Spirit in youth group and small-group Bible studies, you help teens deepen their faith. Plus, you equip them for a
purposeful life of service in the church and in the world.
According to the Bible, the gifts of the Holy Spirit differ from
spiritual gifts. The seven gifts from the Spirit are:
- Prophecy
- Teaching
- Exhorting
- Service
- Leading
- Giving
- Mercy
Evangelical Christians cite these New Testament Bible verses as sources for gifts of the Spirit.
Romans 12:6-8; 1 Corinthians 12:7-10; 1 Corinthians 12:28; Ephesians 4:11.
Various sources use different terminology for the gifts of the Holy Spirit. The Catholic Church teaches that the gifts are found in
Isaiah 11:1-2. Those seven gifts are:
- Wisdom
- Understanding
- Counsel
- Fortitude
- Knowledge
- Piety
- Fear of the Lord
Gifts of the Holy Spirit: Resources for Youth Ministry
For more insights about these important gifts, review the material below. Also turn to denominational resources that reflect the specific beliefs of your faith tradition.
-
The 7 Gifts of the Holy Spirit
First, check out this informative
explanation of the gifts. From a historical perspective, the website explains that Saint Bonaventure (who lived in the 13th century) popularized reflecting on these gifts as a devotional practice. Pastor Michael A. Milton writes that these gifts, ‚Äúwhen applied to the activity of the Holy Spirit in the life of a Christian,‚Äù are not exhaustive. ‚ÄúThey are evidence of the operation of the Spirit of God in the life of His child.‚Äù
-
Differences Between Spiritual Gifts & The Gifts of the Spirit
This
website provides helpful distinctions between these biblical giftings. For example, God blesses us with spiritual gifts to build up his church and help it accomplish its mission. But he blesses people with gifts of the Holy Spirit to help us become more holy and to grow closer to him.
-
Why the Gifts of the Holy Spirit Are So Vital
Here‚Äôs a thorough
https://youcat.org/credopedia/gifts-of-the-holy-spirit/ of why the church needs each of the seven gifts. The working of the Holy Spirit in the Church ‚Äúis evident from the mere fact that it still exists after 2,000 years,‚Äù the website notes.
